title: Architect
description:
**Architect**
**Who We Are:**
Populous has designed and delivered some of the world's most memorable civic, sports and entertainment buildings, from iconic stadia to ground-breaking live music venues. Populous is where architects and designers of all kinds create moments bigger than ourselves. We’re a global specialized design firm with local roots in 11 cities across Americas. Populous offers the best of both worlds: the resources and impact of the design giants and the tightly knit atmosphere and growth opportunities of smaller firms.
**What We Offer:**
Professional On-Site Development/training Programs + Summer Hours + Flexible Schedule / Hybrid Schedule + Paid Architect Licensure & Certifications Exams + Wedding Pay + Freaky Fridays + Charitable Match Program + Market Leading Wellness Health and Welfare Benefits.

**Who We Are Looking For:**
Our preferred candidate will have prior experience in the AEC industry, and an interest in working in a dynamic global design environment with a diverse range of public assembly building types, including sports venues, convention centers, and transportation facilities.
**Populous’ New York Office**
The New York office opened in early 2016. The office is now located in the famed Starrett-Lehigh Building, on 26th Street in between 11th Avenue and the West Side Highway. The office focuses on a wide range of project types and services including sports and entertainment venues, theatre and performing arts, aviation, convention centers, hospitality, mixed-use projects and interior design. It is an office founded on critical thinking and an ability to leverage digital technologies in service of exceptional design. Populous’ New York office is a dynamic and growing group with a wide-range of skills and experience.
Preferred candidates to join our New York team will have an interest in working in a dynamic and collaborative global design environment with an emphasis on communication and pushing the boundaries of what’s possible.

**What Your Day Could Consist Of:**
* The candidate will work within a dynamic creative environment, providing high level conceptual realization of design work in a variety of image and media formats.
* The position would focus on design conceptualization and development of solutions to a project’s programmatic requirements. In addition, candidates would be expected to provide leadership during technical development and project documentation.
* The candidate should be highly adaptable, having a diverse skill set and comfort level working in multiple media platforms. Capabilities should include illustration talents, computer generated renderings, animations, and the production of motion graphics in various forms for visual communication of the conceptual idea.
* Lead in developing, modifying, and reviewing design concepts, production drawings and construction documents according to established standards and technical expertise.
* Develop design concepts and documents during the schematic and design development stages.
* Manage and / or assist in design and operational research, building & systems programming, site and building analysis and report documentation.
* Manage and / or assist in preparing design presentations to clients, communities, and other pertinent stakeholders, including public agencies.
* Assist Project Managers in the construction administration process.
* Coordinate directly with clients in the day-to-day project management of the design development process as well as construction administration.
* All other duties and responsibilities required.

**Requirements For Success:**
* Strong communication skills, team oriented, self-driven work ethic and ability to meet fast paced project demands.
* Inventive, creative design thinking, collaborative skill, architectural production, spatial and environmental design ability, story creation, and quality design sensibility is a requisite.
* Rendering and 3D modeling experience with 3DS Max, SketchUp and Maxwell Render is preferred.
* Experience with Revit is preferred.
* Strong sketching and freehand drawings skills. Ability to create quick sketches to convey/sell an idea is critical.
* Proficiency in Photoshop, Illustrator and InDesign preferred.

**Essential Qualifications:**
* Master’s or bachelor’s degree in architecture.
* Registered Architect with a current license.
* 6-8 years of professional architectural experience.

**Additional details:**
* Travel will be required.
* Overtime may be necessary.

**COMPENSATION:**
* The projected salary range for this opportunity is $78,264 - $97,830 annually, and may be more or less depending on skills, experience and education.
Populous offers a competitive salary and bonus packages. We strive to offer our staff the best benefits package in the industry, at the lowest cost to employees, including medical, dental and vision coverage, 401k, flexible spending accounts, paid time off and continuing education benefits. Populous is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, age, genetic information, sexual orientation, status as a protected veteran or status as a qualified individual with a disability, or any other characteristic protected by applicable Federal, State or Local law.
No. 1 Most Innovative Company in Architecture by *Fast Company*
One of the 50 most innovative companies in the world for 2022 by *Fast Company*
No. 1 AEC firm in convention and conference facilities sector by *BD+C*
No. 19 Architecture Firms of 2021 by *Architectural Record*
Find us here - https://populous.com/careers
Instagram: @WeArePopulous
Twitter: @Populous
company_description: Populous is a global design firm that designs the places where people love to be together.

title: Pool Manager
description:
Head Lifeguard responsibilities include providing professional and courteous service to every guest, ensuring safety of all patrons by preventing and responding to emergencies, and promote order through administrative duties and facility upkeep. Enforce policies, rules, and regulations of all pool areas to maintain our patrons’ wellbeing and comfort.


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES


* Monitor activities at the pool to prevent accidents, and to ensure safety of all guests while in the pool or pool areas.
* Oversee lifeguard staff and rotation during each shift.
* Work Directly with Aquatics Director to manage daily operations.
  
* Caution and educate swimmers regarding unsafe practices and safety hazards; enforce and adhere to pool rules and regulations.
  
* Provide a high level of safety by preventing accidents and saving lives in all scenarios; rescue swimmers in danger of drowning; and, administer first aid when necessary.
  
* Maintain constant surveillance of patrons in the facility, as well act immediately and appropriately to secure safety of patrons in the event of emergency.
  
* Respond quickly, intelligently, decisively, and in accordance with established emergency and accident management procedures.
  
* Be alert and use logical thinking to assess a situation where life and safety may be at risk.
  
* Responsible for the availability and safekeeping of emergency equipment.
  
* Must adhere to practices of occupational safety and health.
  
* Greet all guests in a courteous manner in accordance with department operating standards.
  
* Recognize and respond to all situations safely and promptly.
  
* Inspect, monitor, and maintain facilities for cleanliness; perform general pool cleaning and maintenance duties.
  
* Keep immediate supervisor informed of all problems or unusual events and/or refer difficult situations to their attention for handling.
  
* Maintain health and sanitation standards of the facility.
  
* Maintain a professional demeanor and a great attitude.
  
* Attend and participate in staff meeting/inservice trainings
  
* Perform all tasks accurately and in a timely manner.
  
* Other duties as assigned.

description:
**Project Architect**
**Who We Are:**
Populous has designed and delivered some of the world's most memorable civic, sports and entertainment buildings, from iconic stadia to ground-breaking live music venues. Populous is where architects and designers of all kinds create moments bigger than ourselves. We’re a global specialized design firm with local roots in 11 cities across Americas. The New York office opened in early 2016. The office is now located in the famed Starrett-Lehigh Building, on 26th Street in between 11th Avenue and the West Side Highway. The office focuses on a wide range of project types and services including sports and entertainment venues, theatre and performing arts, aviation, convention centers, hospitality, mixed-use projects and interior design. It is an office founded on critical thinking and an ability to leverage digital technologies in service of exceptional design. Populous’ New York office is a dynamic and growing group with a wide-range of skills and experience.
Preferred candidates to join our New York team will have an interest in working in a dynamic and collaborative global design environment with an emphasis on communication and pushing the boundaries of what’s possible.

**What Your Day Could Consist Of:**
* Delivery of architectural projects from conception through construction.
* Researches code requirements and ensures feasibility of design solutions.
* Follows and manages project budget, work plan, consultants and schedule.
* Communicates with Project Manager regarding key deliverable dates.
* Creates design solutions to meet client specifications, creates and proposes budget and time estimations.
* Maintains a collaborative professional working relationship with the Project Leadership Team (i.e. Project Designer, Project Manager, and Principal in Charge).
* Acts as an intermediary between the client and the architectural team.
* Fosters on-going communication through team meetings, minutes, and up-date memos to project team including consultants.
* Ensures project documentation is in compliance with the standards set forth by Populous policy.

* Consistently reviews work and communicate needs and concerns to project staff.

**Requirements For Success:**

* Strong organizational skills.
* Guide design, construction methodology, material application, and manufacturer-supplier appropriateness.
* Understanding of architectural building systems.
* Thorough understanding of project work plans, schedules, staffing, and budgets a must.
* Advanced knowledge of sustainability, integrated design and LEED guidelines.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite.
* Proficiency in, AutoCAD, Autodesk, Revit, required. Familiarity with Newforma preferred.
* Communicates professionally both verbally and in writing.
* Works in a team environment.
* Meets deadlines.
* Highly self-motivated personality.

**Essential Qualifications:**
* Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Architecture from an accredited program.
* 8+ years of experience in architectural practice with prior experience in all phases of architectural projects.
* Project design experience with sport stadium, arenas, convention centers, hospitality, and aviation a strong plus.
* Registered Architect with a current license.
* NCARB registration preferred.
* LEED not required, but a plus.

**COMPENSATION:**
* The projected salary range for this opportunity is $78,264 - $97,830 annually, and may be more or less depending on skills, experience and education.
**Additional details:**
* Travel will be required.
* Overtime will be required.

Populous offers a competitive salary, bonus and benefit packages, including medical, dental and vision coverage, 401k, flexible spending accounts, paid time off and continuing education benefits. Populous is an equal opportunity employer. title: Specifications Writer
description:
**Specifications Writer**
**Who We Are:**
Populous has designed and delivered some of the world's most memorable civic, sports and entertainment buildings, from iconic stadia to ground-breaking live music venues. Populous is where architects and designers of all kinds create moments bigger than ourselves. We’re a global specialized design firm with local roots in 11 cities across the Americas. Populous offers the best of both worlds: the resources and impact of the design giants and the tightly knit atmosphere and growth opportunities of smaller firms.
**What We Offer:**
Professional Development & Training Programs + Summer Hours + Flexible Schedule / Hybrid Schedule + Paid Architect Licensure & Certifications Exams + Wedding Pay + Freaky Fridays + Charitable Match Program + Market Leading Wellness Health and Welfare Benefits.
**Who We Are Looking For:**
We are seeking a passionate, creative, engaged, and technically proficient Specifications Writer to join us in a dynamic and collaborative design atmosphere.
The preferred candidate will have an interest in working in a dynamic and collaborative global design environment with a diverse range of public assembly building types, including the design of sports venues, convention centers, community buildings and transportation facilities. Applicants must possess exceptional technical abilities.
**What Your Day Could Consist Of:**
* Reviews drawings and other documents to write and edit specifications for projects and coordinates compliance with project requirements, institutional guidelines, Populous standards, technical conditions, acceptable standards, and existing laws, rules, regulations, and codes.
* Interprets the project design requirements and translates those requirements into materials, methods, equipment, procedures, installation, and certification testing necessary to provide the narrative descriptions which are used to procure, install, and erect building components.
* Participates in fostering a green workplace through sustainable work practices.
* Integrates sustainable design initiatives into specifications.
* Participates in QA/QC reviews and checks on project documents.
* Coordinates specifications with Building Information Modeling (BIM) strategies and specification writing software.
* Collaborates with project managers and architects with material and system constructability analysis.
* Performs product research; assists project designers with material selection and system research.
* Participates in quality management reviews and technical advice in design development through construction document phases.
* Assists project architects with shop drawing and product substitution review.
* Coordinates and reviews consultant technical specifications for conformance with Populous standards.
* Acts as a risk management resource to other project leaders.
* Develops and maintains relationships with vendors.
* Develops new specification sections as needed.
* Participates in developing and improving Populous document standards and best practice procedures and bridges the gap between design professionals, specifications, LEED, QA/QC and construction administration.
* All other duties and responsibilities as required.

  

**Requirements For Success:**
* Ability to work on a team, as well as independently. This role works **very closely** with architects, designers, consultants, and other spec writers to complete projects.
* Strong knowledge of architectural design, engineering coordination, design trends, products, construction methodology, building systems, material application, and manufacturer-supplier appropriateness.
* Strong knowledge of construction procedures and schedules.
* Strong knowledge of building envelope components, interior plans and material requirements of all building and facility types. Knowledge in sports, convention centers, aviation, healthcare, higher education, or other large assembly type building specifications is preferred but not required.
* Strong knowledge of building codes and ability to research and apply/incorporate into technical documents.
* Proficiency in specifications software programs such as e-SPECS preferred.
* Proficiency in MS Office, including Word, Excel, and Outlook.
* Proficiency in NewForma platform preferred.
* Ability to produce well-coordinated, detail-oriented, fully integrated specifications.
* Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously and produce results within deadlines.


**Essential Qualifications:**
* Bachelor’s degree in Architecture or equivalent in appropriate education and experience required.
* Construction Specifications Institute certification preferred (CDT).
* LEED Green or equivalent experience in sustainable design preferred.
* Minimum 5 years in architectural practice with prior experience in specifications development.


**Additional details:*** Overtime may be required.


**Compensation:**
* The projected salary range for this opportunity is $101,475 - $ 129,380 annually, and may be more or less depending on skills, experience and education.
